segments.pli: “Cattārimāni, bhikkhave, devānaṃ devapadāni avisuddhānaṃ sattānaṃ visuddhiyā apariyodātānaṃ sattānaṃ pariyodapanāya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these four footprints of the gods are in order to purify unpurified beings and cleanse unclean beings.

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: Firstly, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.
Idaṃ paṭhamaṃ devānaṃ devapadaṃ avisuddhānaṃ sattānaṃ visuddhiyā apariyodātānaṃ sattānaṃ pariyodapanāya.
segments.en: This is the first footprint of the gods in order to purify unpurified beings and cleanse unclean beings.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako dhamme … pe …
segments.en: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the teaching …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi … pe … samādhisaṃvattanikehi.
segments.en: Furthermore, a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion.

segments.pli: Idaṃ catutthaṃ devānaṃ devapadaṃ avisuddhānaṃ sattānaṃ visuddhiyā apariyodātānaṃ sattānaṃ pariyodapanāya.
segments.en: This is the fourth footprint of the gods in order to purify unpurified beings and cleanse unclean beings.

segments.pli: Imāni kho, bhikkhave, cattāri devānaṃ devapadāni avisuddhānaṃ sattānaṃ visuddhiyā apariyodātānaṃ sattānaṃ pariyodapanāyā”ti.
segments.en: These four footprints of the gods are in order to purify unpurified beings and cleanse unclean beings.”

suttaplex.blurb: The four factors of stream-entry are footprints of the gods.
